title: Aluminum Prices Hit 3-Year High: Is It the Next Key Metal in the Clean Energy Shift?
summary: Aluminum prices have reached a three-year high, driven by strong demand from electric vehicles, solar installations, and grid upgrades. The surge is reshaping supply chains as the metal becomes increasingly important for the transition to a low-carbon economy.

title: Aluminum Price Falls Slightly to $2,805.70/ton on November 21, 2025
summary: Aluminum prices dropped 0.25% to $2,805.70 per ton on November 21, 2025, but remain elevated compared to previous months. The market has seen overall upward pressure due to trade tariffs and supply chain dynamics.

title: Aluminium Historical Prices: November 18–21, 2025
summary: Recent data shows aluminum prices fluctuating between $2,783.80 and $2,863.30 per ton over the past week. The market remains volatile, reflecting ongoing global supply and demand shifts.

title: Aluminium News: Market Updates and Price Movements
summary: Latest headlines cover ongoing price changes and market developments in the aluminum sector, including impacts from tariffs and evolving demand patterns.

title: Aluminum Prices Edge Up in China, Close Above 21,405 Yuan/mt
summary: Chinese aluminum prices pulled back from intraday highs but closed above 21,405 yuan per metric ton, reflecting sustained demand and regional market strength.

title: Aluminum industry mulls unveiled CBAM benchmarks, default values
summary: Aluminum producers are reviewing the newly released CBAM (Carbon Border Adjustment Mechanism) benchmarks and default values, which could have significant implications for trade and compliance in the European market. The industry is assessing how these benchmarks will affect costs and competitiveness.

title: World's top aluminum producer adds markups as Trump tariffs drive up costs
summary: Rio Tinto Group is imposing surcharges on aluminum shipments to the U.S. due to low inventories and increased demand, further disrupting the North American market already affected by import tariffs. The move highlights ongoing supply chain challenges and rising costs for consumers.

title: Investing In Innovation: GBCCA Showcases New Technology To Close The Recycling Loop For Aluminium Cans
summary: The Global Beverage Can Circularity Alliance (GBCCA) presented breakthrough innovations at Climate Week NYC 2025 aimed at achieving nearly 100% recycling of aluminium beverage cans by 2050. Technologies such as robotics, AI, user-friendly deposit return systems, and home recycling equipment are highlighted as key drivers to close the recycling loop and accelerate a circular economy for aluminium.

title: At COP30: Can-to-Can Recycling Delivers 18% Higher Efficiency and Major Climate Benefits for Aluminium Beverage Cans
summary: A new study by Innoval Technology highlights that can-to-can recycling of aluminium beverage cans can increase melt recovery rates by 18% and reduce energy use and greenhouse gas emissions by 15% compared to mixed-alloy recycling. The study supports expanding Deposit Return Systems (DRS) across the EU and UK to improve scrap quality and enable higher recovery rates, contributing to national climate commitments.

title: Sustainable Aluminum Market Trends and Top Companies In 2024
summary: The global aluminum market is projected to grow significantly, driven by innovations in low-carbon aluminum production. RUSAL, a leading producer, uses renewable electricity for over 90% of its aluminum production and has developed a new 5xxx series aluminum alloy optimized for anodizing, enhancing corrosion resistance and product lifespan. These advancements reflect ongoing efforts to reduce greenhouse gas emissions across production stages.

title: How Aluminum Will Contribute to a Cleaner North America
summary: Aluminum is recognized as a key material for sustainability due to its lightweight, durability, and infinite recyclability. The article reviews the latest sustainability efforts in aluminum production, including mining and smelting practices in Australia and Canada, and highlights cutting-edge low-carbon technologies and high-recycled-content products like Longboard ECO™ that support a cleaner future.

title: Smol launches refillable bottles made from 100% recycled aluminium
summary: Smol has introduced refillable bottles made entirely from 100% recycled aluminium, aligning with new packaging and packaging waste regulations effective in 2025. This innovation supports sustainability by promoting reuse and recycling in packaging, reducing the environmental footprint of aluminum products.

title: Steel Rebounds to Highest in November
summary: Steel rebar futures in China climbed to CNY 3,090 per tonne, the highest since early November, driven by Beijing's anti-involution policy reducing supply. Crude steel output in China fell 12% year-on-year in October, contributing to the price rebound despite a slight daily decline.

title: CRU: APAC steel prices continued to decline amid weak demand
summary: Chinese steel export prices declined due to weak domestic demand and tax-evading shipments, pulling down wider Asia-Pacific markets. In contrast, European sheet prices rose on import supply concerns related to trade policies, while US sheet prices increased significantly, surpassing landed import prices for the first time since July.

title: What the Data Says: Steel Price Updates
summary: Structural steel prices in North America stabilized after a 10% drop from Q2 to Q3 2025, with October prices at $2,477.25/ton, down 6.63% from Q3. Year-over-year, steel prices are down 4.7%, reflecting a continuing long-term decline in steel costs.

title: Low prices of steel problem for small companies: Secretary Sandeep Poundrik
summary: Secretary Sandeep Poundrik highlighted that low steel prices are problematic for small companies, noting that prices were higher five years ago than they should have been. The government is imposing safeguard duties on imports to protect domestic producers, while steel consumption and capacity are increasing.

title: American steel producers are gradually raising prices for rolled products
summary: US steel producers like Nucor Bar Group are increasing prices for rebar by $30 per short ton for new orders after November 7, reflecting a gradual price rise in rolled steel products amid market adjustments.

title: Steel Mills Maintain High Hot Rolled Production Schedule in November
summary: In November 2025, the production schedule for hot-rolled commercial steel from 39 mainstream steel mills decreased by 2.2% month-over-month (MoM). However, due to November having fewer days than October, the daily average production schedule for hot-rolled products increased slightly by 1.0% MoM. Demand in the automotive sector remains strong, supporting moderate resilience in hot-rolled coil supply.

title: Weekly Raw Steel Production - Week Ending November 15, 2025
summary: Domestic raw steel production in the U.S. was 1,745,000 net tons for the week ending November 15, 2025, with a capability utilization rate of 76.2%. This represents an 8.3% increase compared to the same week in 2024 but a slight 0.7% decrease from the previous week. The data reflects ongoing production trends in the U.S. steel industry.

title: Global Steel Production Ticked Higher in October
summary: After four consecutive monthly declines, global crude steel output increased by 1% from September to October 2025, reaching an estimated 143.3 million metric tons. China accounted for 50% of global production in October, producing 72.0 million metric tons, down 2% from September. Production outside China rose to a five-month high, increasing 4% from September.

title: Major Chinese Steelmaker Signs Landmark Contract with Primetals Technologies
summary: A major Chinese steelmaker signed a landmark contract with Primetals Technologies to supply two continuous slab casters, indicating ongoing investment in steel production capacity and modernization in China.

title: American Steel Producers Are Gradually Raising Prices for Rolled Products
summary: American steel producers have been gradually increasing prices for rolled steel products, with price protection applying to confirmed deals shipped before November 23, 2025. Market monitoring continues as producers adjust to demand and cost conditions.

title: India's Power Ministry Honors M.P.K. Steels for Pioneering Energy-Efficient Manufacturing Technology
summary: M.P.K. Steels has been recognized by India's Power Ministry for implementing advanced energy-efficient technologies in its steel production facilities. The award highlights the company's leadership in sustainable manufacturing and sets a new benchmark for energy conservation in the industry.

title: Steel's carbon emissions dilemma: Retrofitting plants offers big cuts
summary: Researchers from UCL have developed a new database and economic model to identify the most cost-effective strategies for reducing carbon emissions from global iron and steel plants. The study emphasizes the importance of government support and tailored technology upgrades for achieving net-zero emissions in the steel sector.

title: Sustainable Steel Conference 2025
summary: The Sustainable Steel Conference 2025 was held in Goa, featuring discussions and presentations on the latest innovations and sustainability initiatives in the global steel industry. The event brought together experts and stakeholders to explore pathways for a greener steel future.

title: Copper prices fall on week-end dollar firm as traders evaluate US employment data
summary: Copper prices at the London Metal Exchange fell 0.39% to $10,696.5 per ton, expected to finish the week with a 1.41% loss. The decline was influenced by a strong US dollar and hawkish Federal Reserve officials, despite prices remaining high this year amid weak demand from China.

title: Comex Copper Ends the Week 0.81% Lower at $5.0085 — Data Talk
summary: Front Month Comex Copper for November delivery closed the week down 0.81% at $5.0085 per pound, marking a decline in three of the past four weeks. Despite the weekly drop, copper is up 25.65% year-to-date and remains well above its 52-week low.

title: Copper rose to 4.99 USD/Lbs on November 21, 2025
summary: Copper prices increased by 0.86% from the previous day to $4.99 per pound, showing a 0.69% rise over the past month and a 22.54% increase compared to the same time last year. The metal reached an all-time high of $5.94 in July 2025.

title: Copper rebounds
summary: Copper prices rebounded after falling as much as 1.2% to $10,607.50, the lowest since November 5. The metal is widely used in power, construction, and manufacturing sectors.

title: Copper Prices Drift Upward Despite Stock Surplus - MetalMiner
summary: Copper prices have been trending upward despite a surplus in stock, influenced by supply disruptions such as incidents at Grasberg mine. Banks like Goldman Sachs and Citi have revised their price forecasts upward, expecting copper prices to remain elevated through 2026-2027.

title: Copper futures fell below $4.95 per pound on Friday amid soft demand and supply concerns
summary: Copper futures dropped to a two-week low due to weak demand in China, affected by a property sector slump and slower power grid spending. Supply concerns persist with Freeport McMoRan planning to resume production at Indonesia’s Grasberg mine by July 2026 after a flood halted operations.

title: Amid Expectations of Copper Concentrate Shortages, How Are Smelters Adjusting Their Operating Strategies
summary: Global copper smelters are aggressively adjusting to worsening concentrate shortages by locking in processing margins early and raising prepayment ratios. Chinese smelters are expanding exports to Southeast Asia and the Middle East to hedge against pricing losses, while refined copper smelting capacity growth is focused in China, Africa, and Indonesia.

title: Surge Copper digs deep: Berg project PFS underway
summary: Surge Copper is advancing a pre-feasibility study (PFS) for its Berg project in British Columbia, aiming for completion in mid-2026. The project promises large-scale copper production alongside molybdenum and precious metals, building on a 2023 preliminary economic assessment.

title: Jubilee Metals Group reports 65% increase in copper production in first quarter
summary: Jubilee Metals Group announced a significant 65% rise in copper production for the first quarter of the 2026 financial year, reflecting strong operational performance and capacity expansion.

title: Azerbaijan capitalises on new copper mines to fuel export surge
summary: Azerbaijan has increased copper ore production and exports significantly in 2025, with new mines boosting output and helping diversify the country's non-oil trade. Exports reached approximately 16,066 tons worth nearly $30 million in the first nine months of 2025.

title: Rewiring a sustainable, clean energy future with copper
summary: Copper demand for clean energy is projected to nearly double by 2050, driven by electrification and renewable energy expansion. The mining industry is adopting responsible practices and increasing recycling, with nearly 80% of all mined copper still in use today. Copper's recyclability and efficiency are central to supporting a sustainable energy transition.

title: Copper Mining Methods 2025: Innovations & Sustainability
summary: The copper mining industry is advancing with innovations such as autonomous equipment, digital transformation, and sustainable extraction methods like in-situ leaching. These technologies are improving efficiency, reducing environmental impact, and supporting responsible resource extraction in 2025.

title: Energy Efficiency in Copper Processing Plants 2025
summary: In 2025, copper processing plants are achieving up to 30% lower emissions through automation, digitization, and integration of renewable energy. Innovations in thermal recovery and blockchain-based traceability are enhancing both sustainability and supply chain transparency.

title: Copper Elevated to Critical Mineral Status: A Strategic Imperative for the Green Transition
summary: Copper has been formally designated as a critical mineral in the 2025 USGS list, highlighting its strategic importance for the green transition. This status is expected to drive innovation in sustainable mining and domestic production, while also presenting challenges in balancing environmental protection and supply needs.

title: Why 'green' copper is critical for modern technologies and a circular economy
summary: Mint Innovation presented its vision for scalable e-waste recovery and green copper at a U.S. Congressional hearing, emphasizing the importance of recycling and sustainable practices. The company has achieved triple ISO certification, underscoring its commitment to quality, environment, and safety standards.

title: [SMM Nickel Midday Review] Nickel Prices Plunge Sharply on November 21 as Expectations for US Fed Interest Rate Cut Weaken
summary: Nickel prices dropped sharply on November 21, 2025, with SMM #1 refined nickel averaging 116,700 yuan/mt, down 1,500 yuan/mt from the previous day. The decline was driven by weaker expectations for a US Federal Reserve interest rate cut amid strong US non-farm payroll data and rising unemployment, creating macroeconomic pressure and high inventory levels that weighed on nickel prices.

title: Nickel rose to 14,620 USD/T on November 21, 2025, up 1.14% from the previous day
summary: Nickel prices increased by 1.14% to 14,620 USD per tonne on November 21, 2025, despite a 3.43% decline over the past month and a 7.80% drop compared to the previous year. The market remains volatile with fluctuations influenced by global economic factors and supply-demand dynamics.

title: Nickel Price Update: Q3 2025 in Review
summary: Nickel prices were volatile in the first half of 2025 but stabilized somewhat in Q3 amid ongoing oversupply concerns, primarily due to rapid production growth in Indonesia. Despite rising consumption, the market remains structurally oversupplied, pressuring prices, with seasonal output declines expected to provide temporary support.

title: Nornickel maintains 2025 nickel production forecast
summary: Nornickel, a leading nickel producer, maintained its 2025 nickel production forecast at 196,000-204,000 metric tons. Production rose 18% in Q3 2025 due to higher volumes of processed raw materials, despite challenges from seasonal flooding and equipment replacement impacting output earlier in the year.

title: Nickel inches down ahead of Fed's decision
summary: Nickel prices edged lower as the US dollar strengthened and market sentiment was bearish ahead of the US Federal Reserve's interest rate decision. The price movement reflects cautious investor positioning amid macroeconomic uncertainty.

title: Nornickel maintains 2025 nickel production forecast
summary: Russia’s Nornickel reported an 18% increase in nickel production to 54,000 metric tons in Q3 2025 compared to the previous quarter. The company maintained its 2025 nickel production forecast at 196,000-204,000 metric tons despite earlier declines caused by equipment replacement and seasonal disruptions.

title: FLASH: Harum Energy Q3 2025 nickel production rises 18.4% Year on Year
summary: PT Harum Energy Tbk reported a 18.4% year-on-year increase in nickel pig iron production to 19,249 tonnes in Q3 2025, with sales up 13.11% quarter-on-quarter. The company’s RKEF utilization rate improved to 89% in the first nine months of 2025, and its HPAL project is over 90% complete, with commissioning planned for early 2026.

title: EV Nickel acquires unpatented mining claim over high-grade Langmuir South and Langmuir #2 nickel zones
summary: EV Nickel Inc. announced the issuance of an unpatented mining claim near Timmins, Ontario, advancing exploration of high-grade nickel mineralization. The company plans diamond drilling pending permit approval expected before the end of 2025, aiming to expand its nickel assets to support North American clean critical mineral supply chains.

title: PT Vale Showcases Indonesia's World-Class Sustainability, Climate-Aligned Nickel at COP30
summary: PT Vale highlighted its technological transformation at COP30, aiming for a 33% reduction in absolute emissions and a 50% reduction in carbon intensity for nickel products by 2030. Innovations such as heat recovery, off-gas utilization, ore dewatering optimization, and electrification are driving these improvements, supporting Indonesia's role in the global energy transition.

title: Strengthen Indonesia's Global Nickel Leadership, PT Vale Indonesia and Huayou Commits to Climate-Aligned Technology Pathways at COP30
summary: PT Vale and Huayou Indonesia announced ambitious climate targets at COP30, including a 33% reduction in absolute emissions and 50% reduction in carbon intensity for nickel products by 2030. Their advanced hydrometallurgical processes, such as waste heat recovery and CO2 solidification, are projected to significantly reduce carbon emissions and improve operational efficiency.

title: Mining with Integrity to Advance Sustainable Nickel Downstreaming
summary: The company aims to cut emissions by 33% by 2030 and reduce the carbon intensity of its nickel products by up to 50%. These efforts are part of a broader push for sustainable nickel production and downstreaming in Indonesia.

title: Cogne Acciai Speciali launches pilot phase of green hydrogen project
summary: Cogne Acciai Speciali has initiated the pilot phase of a green hydrogen project in Italy, marking a significant step in the company's efforts to decarbonize its steel production processes. The project is supported by public funding and aligns with Italy's National Recovery and Resilience Plan.
query: Cogne Acciai Speciali news aluminum steel italy

title: Italy's Cogne Acciai Speciali launches green hydrogen pilot plant
summary: Cogne Acciai Speciali has launched a green hydrogen pilot plant in Italy, aiming to reduce carbon emissions in steel manufacturing. The initiative is backed by around EUR 8 million in public funding and is part of Italy's National Recovery and Resilience Plan.
query: Cogne Acciai Speciali news aluminum steel italy

title: Tenaris hosts panel on nuclear energy and Italy's boilermaking future
summary: Tenaris hosted a panel discussion in Italy on the future of the Italian boilermaking industry and the role of nuclear energy in Europe's energy transition. The event highlighted Tenaris's recent accreditation to supply certified materials for nuclear facilities under ASME III standards, emphasizing their commitment to quality and safety in nuclear manufacturing.

title: Tenaris in dialogue with Macchi at Hydrogen Expo 2025
summary: Tenaris participated in Hydrogen Expo 2025 in Piacenza, Italy, discussing steel solutions for power generation with a focus on sustainability and innovation. The company highlighted its tailored tubular products for high-temperature applications and its investments in manufacturing capabilities for advanced power generation needs.

title: Tenaris to launch TenarisShawcor White Jacket™ coating at the Hydrogen and CCUS Technology World Expo
summary: Tenaris announced the launch of its new TenarisShawcor White Jacket™ coating, developed in Italy for severe onshore and underground pipeline applications, including hydrogen and carbon capture transportation. The coating offers enhanced resistance to embrittlement and mechanical protection for demanding environments.

title: Italian expertise fuels Prysmian innovation
summary: Prysmian is investing heavily in R&D in Italy, with €216 million invested between 2021 and 2024 and plans for an additional €270 million by 2028. The Milan R&D center is central to Prysmian’s innovation strategy, focusing on high-voltage terrestrial and submarine transmission systems and renewable energy integration, supported by Italian government funding.

title: Prysmian shares rise as Italian cable maker seen as winner amid US copper tariffs
summary: Prysmian's shares rose nearly 4% due to expectations that its large US business will benefit from US copper tariffs. The company’s vertically integrated copper sourcing and production in the US gives it a competitive edge, especially in the low-voltage cable sector, strengthening margins despite tariff impacts on demand.

title: Prysmian awarded framework agreement from Terna to improve the Italian power grid
summary: Prysmian secured a framework agreement with Italy's Terna to supply and install 420 kV cables and accessories, manufactured partly at Prysmian’s Italian plant in Arco Felice. This contract reinforces Prysmian’s leadership in high-voltage cable solutions and supports the modernization of Italy’s power grid infrastructure.

title: Prysmian Named As Preferred Bidder For Major UK High Voltage Energy Interconnection Project
summary: Prysmian was named the preferred bidder for a significant UK high voltage energy interconnection project, highlighting its leadership in submarine and terrestrial cable systems. This award reflects Prysmian’s ongoing role in large-scale energy infrastructure projects, leveraging its Italian expertise and global capabilities.

title: Prysmian awarded The Italy-Tunisia Interconnection
summary: Prysmian secured a contract for the Italy-Tunisia interconnection project, involving the supply and installation of submarine and land cables. This project underscores Prysmian’s strategic role in enhancing cross-border energy connectivity in the Mediterranean region.
